ref: 5846 tīrthá n. ʻ ford, steps to a river, place of pilgrimage ʼ RV. [~ *tūrtha -- . -- &rcirclemacr Pa. Pk. tittha -- n. ʻ ford, descent to a river, landing place ʼ; S. tithu f. ʻ place of residence, end ʼ (?); Bi. tīthā ʻ catch -- basin into which the bucket at the well is emptied ʼ; -- Si. tit ʻ heresy ʼ EGS 64 is, like tit ʻ heretic ʼ GS 38, ← Pa.
